results.title: Deconstructing Harry. Mighty Aphrodite
results.brief_description: Mighty Aphrodite (1995): Writer-director Woody Allen plays Lenny, a sportswriter who is dissatisfied in his marriage to art dealer, Amanda. Lenny becomes obsessed with locating his adopted son’s natural mother, feeling convinced that she will be a brilliant and intelligent person. Instead she’s Linda, a ditzy porn star and prostitute. Despite the initial disillusionment, Lenny soon develops a fondness for Linda, and decides to help her get her life back on track. Cast includes: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Helena Bonham Carter, Michael Rapaport, F. Murray Abraham, Olympia Dukakis and Peter Weller. Deconstructing Harry (1997): Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel, “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself,including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.

results.title: Decoder
results.brief_description: The behaviour of the people in the Western World is being altered by an aural weapon devised to subconsciously affect those exposed to it. This artificial product, created by scientists, musicians and marketing experts is called “Musak” or “functional music”. The authors of this film carried out intensive research before making “Decoder” as the function of “musak” is to stimulate or soothe, enhancing wellbeing by constructing a particular tonal sequence. “Musak” by its very nature has an undoubted political significance. This production blends reality and fiction: surreal, metaphorical imagery interwoven with music.

results.title: Decisive discipline: every move you make
results.creator_credit: Bill Rogers and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description: A kit produced by Bill Rogers and the Institute of Educational Administration which advocates certain decisive discipline strategies which could be utilised by a classroom teacher. The kit consists of two videotapes and an accompanying booklet which provides background information and print summaries from the videotapes. Highlights some classroom discipline problems and strategies for dealing with them.

results.title: Decisions, Decisions! (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Illustrates problems managers can encounter when failing to approach decision making and implementation logically. Demonstrates the importance of utilising the knowledge and views of the team when deciding on matters affecting them. Famous decision makers from the past, Brutus, Queen Elizabeth I, Churchill and Montgomery, act as a review panel and confront an incompetent manager with his mistakes. Features John Cleese and Prunella Scales. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Decisions, decisions (NP)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the problems an office manager can come up against if he fails to approach decision making and implementation in a logical manner. Demonstrates how important it is for managers to use the knowledge and views of their team when deciding on matters that affect the team. Famous decision makers from the past, Brutus, Queen Elizabeth I, Churchill, Montgomery act as a review panel and confront an incompetent manager with his mistakes. Features John Cleese. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Decisions in academic departments
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Trigger series 7. Managing people”.
Six dramatisations dealing with interpersonal aspects of staff management are designed to trigger discussion. Although set in a university the issues raised are common to all organisations.

results.title: Decisions
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films and Stephen Judson
results.brief_description: Covers a variety of situations requiring decision-making ranging from the simple to the complex. Outlines practical procedures and psychological aspects such as anxiety, self-doubt and the fear of being wrong. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Decision for chemistry
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions, Monsanto Chemical Company and Sidney Meyers
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the chemical industry and its role in everyday living. Mentions the development of fire-resistant materials, treatment of soil with phosphates and Krilium products; the use of detergents in the laundry industry; the development of new textile fibres; and research on radio-active materials. For modern youth, with an enquiring mind, wonderful opportunities for a worth-while career are offered by the chemical industry.
